title: A Sad Story About a Missing Swimmer
summary: A man's body was found in the sea, and police think it is Matthew Upham, an antiques shop owner who went missing on Christmas Day. He was swimming with another man, and both disappeared. Emergency services were called to Exmouth Beach in Devon after someone saw the body. Matthew's family has been told, and they are very sad. He was 64 years old and lived in Budleigh Salterton. His friend said he went into the water to help a woman who was in trouble. The coastguard and RNLI searched for the missing swimmers but had to stop. Other swim events were canceled because of bad weather. Police are asking people with information to come forward.

background_read: This story is about a sad event where two men went missing while swimming in the sea on Christmas Day. Swimming in the sea can be dangerous, especially in bad weather. Emergency services like the coastguard and RNLI work hard to help people in trouble. It's important to be careful near water and listen to weather warnings. Families can feel very sad when someone goes missing, and police ask for help to find out what happened.
Article_Structure: WHO: Matthew Upham, a 64-year-old antiques shop owner from Budleigh Salterton, and another swimmer.
WHAT: A body was found in the sea, believed to be Matthew, who went missing on Christmas Day.
WHERE: Exmouth Beach in Devon, England.
WHY: Matthew went into the sea to help a woman in difficulty, and bad weather made swimming dangerous.

perspectives.description: Matthew's family is sad and misses him, thanking emergency services for their help.
